des:
Detect new emails and notify Alexa as a motion sensor.

This skill alone cannot read emails.
Please use it together with the "mailSpeak" skill separately.
(Search for "mailSpeak" from Skills in the Alexa app.)
URL https://mailspeak.jp/

Setup instructions:

1) Enable the smaSensor skill in the Alexa app.

2) For the account link, please use the same account as the one you obtained in advance with "mailSpeak".

After successful account linking, proceed to device detection.
Alexa recognizes two types of motion sensors: "smaSensor" and "smaButton" switches.

3) When you receive an email, the smaSensor will react as a smart home motion sensor.
(You can also check your email address by logging into your mailSpeak account at https://mailspeak.jp/)

4) Create an Alexa canned action to read out new emails.

Select "smaSensor" as the execution condition, and select "mailSpeak" as the action from the skills.
(Alternatively, it is OK to specify "Start mailSpeak" in "Custom")
The smaSensor works as a motion sensor, but does not support "undetected" (detection only).

By selecting "smaSensor" from smart home as the execution condition of Alexa's fixed action,
By executing "mailSpeak" with that detection as a trigger, mailSpeak reads out new mail.

5) After creating a fixed action, when you receive an email, mailSpeak will read out and display the new email.

Use the mailSpeak Advanced Settings screen to make various settings for reading mail.

How to check and activate the smaSensor skill:

Say "Alexa, activate the smaButton" or "Alexa, turn on the smaButton".
The same operation (notification to Alexa) as when the smaSensor detects an email,
Respond to the invocation with something like "yes".
If you are working with mailSpeak, read out that the operation is normal.
